course_title: Studies In Women's Fiction: Contemporary Women Novelist
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 25 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
Topic: CONTEMPORARY WOMEN NOVELIST: UPENDING THE ROMANCE PLOT 
Course Description: From medieval times to the present, the romance narrative has survived as one of the most enduring myths of western culture, despite questions about how well its Happily-Ever-After plot accurately depicts actual contemporary relationships.  This course will explore how five novelists have rewritten myth, history, fairy tales, and science fiction to interrogate the traditional romance plot, from Cinderella to sitcoms, as they explore love and friendship today.  
 
TEXTS:  Rooney, CONVERSATIONS WITH FRIENDS; Conde, I, TITUBA, BLACK WITCH OF SALEM; Newitz, AUTONOMOUS; Carter, THE BLOODY CHAMBER; Atwood, PENELOPAID;  REQUIREMENTS: informed class participation; regular short response paragraphs; and two short papers.
course_description: Selected prose works of British and American women, including authors such as Behn, Austen, Woolf, Lessing, Morrison, and Walker. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
